Html:
Hi, currently the user has to click the cell to select the cell, click again to see the combo box and then click for the third time to get the combo box to drop down.

Anyone know of a way (in code) of automatically opening the combo on the edit click?

Thanks

The following should open the dropdown of combobox when ever it gets into edit mode. You can do something similar in the code if you want...

    <toolkit:DataGridComboBoxColumn ...>

                   <toolkit:DataGridComboBoxColumn.EditingElementStyle>

                        <Style TargetType="{x:Type ComboBox}">

                            <Setter Property="IsDropDownOpen" Value="True"></Setter>

                        </Style>

                    </toolkit:DataGridComboBoxColumn.EditingElementStyle>
        </toolkit:DataGridComboBoxColumn>
Additionally, you could do that single click editing hack in the tips and tricks.  Along with what Vamsee is saying, it should open the dropdown on a single click even when it's not in editing mode.

Thanks very much. I added the following code and it works a treat...

 

Dim lobjPropSetter As New System.Windows.Setter(System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox.IsDropDownOpenProperty, True)

 

 

Dim lobjComboBoxColumnStyle As New Style(GetType(System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox))

 

lobjComboBoxColumnStyle.Setters.Add(lobjPropSetter)

 

Me.EditingElementStyle = lobjComboBoxColumnStyle
